tokenactionhud.title: Token Action HUD
tokenactionhud.handlerNotFound: not found, reverting to core roller.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.rollHandler.name: HUD roll handler
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.rollHandler.hint: Choose which module will receive the HUD's actions.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.enabledForUser.h: If enabled, the HUD is active for the user. Does not override the player permission setting.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.onTokenHover.hin:
If enabled, the HUD will appear when hovering over a controllable token.
Warning: Due to the unpredictable position of a token on the canvas, some actiosn may fall off the screen.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.playerPermission: If enabled, players will be able to use the HUD.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.debug.name: Enable debugging
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.ignorePass: If enabled, passive feats are not shown.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showSpellI: If enabled, spell component information, concentration, and ritual status will be noted next to the spell name.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showAllNon: If disabled, spells such as cantrips, innate, pact, and at-will spells need to be 'prepared' via the spell details to be shown on the HUD.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.hideLonger: Hide actions with an activation longer than 1 round
If enabled, actions with longer activation types (minutes, hours, or days) are not shown.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.abbreviate: If enabled, skills and abilities will use a three-character abbreviation.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.splitAbili: Show separate ability check and save categories
If enabled, abilities will be separated into checks and saves.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showAllNpc: If enabled, all items are shown for NPCs, not just equipped items.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.showPcAbili: If enabled, PCs will also have an Abilities category on their HUD.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.showNpcAbil: If enabled, NPCs will also have an Abilities category on their HUD.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.calculateAt: If enabled, strikes will show their calculated attack bonus (attack bonus - MAP) instead of the flat MAP.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.printSpellC: If disabled, left-clicking a spell will roll attack (shift right-click for bonus dialogue), right-clicking will roll damage (ctrl right-click for bonus dialogue). If neither are applicable, the spell card will be printed to chat anyway.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.abbreviateS: If enabled, skills and abilities will use a three-character abbreviation.
tokenactionhud.tokenactionhud.settings.dungeonworld.sho: If enabled, and if the user is a GM, the HUD bar will include GM moves, treasure rollable-tables, and charts.
